Choices: a : Donald Hebb | b : Tom M. Mitchell | c : Arthur Samuel | d : Walter Pitts

MCQ: What was the name of the experimental 'learning machine' developed by Raytheon Company in the early 1960s?
Choices: a : Cybernet | b : Cybertron | c : Cyberdyne | d : Cyberlink

MCQ: According to Tom M. Mitchell, what is the definition of machine learning algorithms?
Choices: a : A computer program learns from experience E with respect to some class of tasks T and performance measure P if its performance at tasks in T improves with experience E. | b : A computer program learns from experience E with respect to some class of tasks T and performance measure P if its performance at tasks in T remains constant with experience E. | c : A computer program learns from experience E with respect to some class of tasks T and performance measure P if its performance at tasks in T deteriorates with experience E. | d : A computer program learns from experience E with respect to some class of tasks T and performance measure P if its performance at tasks in T is irrelevant to experience E.

MCQ: What are the two main objectives of modern-day machine learning?
Choices: a : To confuse data based on models and to make predictions for past outcomes. | b : To classify data based on models and to make predictions for future outcomes. | c : To analyze data based on models and to make predictions for future outcomes. | d : To generate data based on models and to make predictions for future outcomes.

MCQ: What did Alan Turing propose in his paper 'Computing Machinery and Intelligence'?
Choices: a : He proposed the question 'Can machines think?' | b : He proposed the question 'Can machines do what we can do?' | c : He proposed the question 'Can machines fly?' | d : He proposed the question 'Can machines swim?'
